William Shakespeare was influenced to start writing by a number of factors, including his education, his personal experiences, and his reading of other writers. 

Shakespeare was born in 1564 into a wealthy family, and he was well-educated. He attended the University of Oxford, where he studied rhetoric and literature. After completing his education, Shakespeare traveled through Europe, where he read a great deal of literature and learned from other writers.
